column7: (Please ensure links point to right numbers)

column1: Cortisol level from adrenals should be 10x's higher than peripheral
A multiple of at least 2-3 times the peripheral value is needed
Unilateral asymmetric aldosteone:cortisol values on the affected side of 3-5 times that obtained on the unaffected side are consistent with lateralization
Aldosteone:cortisol ratios that are elevated, but differ by less than twofold between the 2 sides, are more consistent with bilateral adrenal hyperplasia
Kahn SL, Angle JF. Adrenal vein sampling. Techniques in Vascular and Interventional Radiology 2010;13(2):110-25.

Chow et al. Role of unilateral-cannulating adrenal venous sampling for the subtyping of primary aldosteronism for adrenalectomy: experience from a low-volume center. World Journal of Surgery 2024;48:2941-9.
Contralateral aldosterone suppression ratio (CR) < 1 would mean contralateral side is positive
CSI/RASI or AV/IVC ratio >5.5 ipsilateral unilateral or <0.5 contralateral unilateral
Naruse M, et al. Adrenal venous sampling for subtype diagnosis of primary hyperaldosteronism. Endocrinology and Metabolism 2021;36(5):965-73.
